title: Appleâ€™s 2FA autofill feature is now better at blocking phishing attacks
content:
Apple’s SMS 2-factor authentication (2FA) autofill feature has been around for a while now. For those unfamiliar with it, when you receive an SMS with a 2FA code, the iOS keyboard will automatically suggest inserting it in the dedicated field. This spares users the hassle of launching the Messages app, copying the code, then pasting

The post Apple’s 2FA autofill feature is now better at blocking phishing attacks appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Apple's SMS 2FA autofill feature no longer works when it detects a potential phishing attack. This change helps protect users.
